segment.source: Merge AppLocker policies by using Set-ApplockerPolicy (Windows 10)
segment.target: Merge AppLocker policies by using Set-ApplockerPolicy (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to merge AppLocker policies by using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to merge AppLocker policies by using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: Merge AppLocker policies by using Set-ApplockerPolicy
segment.target: Merge AppLocker policies by using Set-ApplockerPolicy

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to merge AppLocker policies by using Windows PowerShell.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to merge AppLocker policies by using Windows PowerShell.

segment.source: The Set-AppLockerPolicy cmdlet sets the specified Group Policy Object (GPO) to contain the specified AppLocker policy.
segment.target: The Set-AppLockerPolicy cmdlet sets the specified Group Policy Object (GPO) to contain the specified AppLocker policy.

segment.source: If no Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) is specified, the local GPO is the default.
segment.target: If no Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) is specified, the local GPO is the default.

segment.source: When the Merge parameter is used, rules in the specified AppLocker policy will be merged with the AppLocker rules in the target GPO specified in the LDAP path.
segment.target: When the Merge parameter is used, rules in the specified AppLocker policy will be merged with the AppLocker rules in the target GPO specified in the LDAP path.

segment.source: The merging of policies will remove rules with duplicate rule IDs, and the enforcement setting specified by the AppLocker policy in the target GPO will be preserved.
segment.target: The merging of policies will remove rules with duplicate rule IDs, and the enforcement setting specified by the AppLocker policy in the target GPO will be preserved.

segment.source: If the Merge parameter is not specified, then the new policy will overwrite the existing policy.
segment.target: If the Merge parameter is not specified, then the new policy will overwrite the existing policy.

segment.source: For info about using Set-AppLockerPolicy, including syntax descriptions and parameters, see Set-AppLockerPolicy.
segment.target: For info about using Set-AppLockerPolicy, including syntax descriptions and parameters, see Set-AppLockerPolicy.

segment.source: For info about using Windows PowerShell for AppLocker, including how to import the AppLocker cmdlets into Windows PowerShell, see Use the AppLocker Windows PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: For info about using Windows PowerShell for AppLocker, including how to import the AppLocker cmdlets into Windows PowerShell, see Use the AppLocker Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: You can also manually merge AppLocker policies.
segment.target: You can also manually merge AppLocker policies.

segment.source: For the procedure to do this, see Merge AppLocker policies manually.
segment.target: For the procedure to do this, see Merge AppLocker policies manually.

segment.source: To merge a local AppLocker policy with another AppLocker policy by using LDAP paths
segment.target: To merge a local AppLocker policy with another AppLocker policy by using LDAP paths

segment.source: Open the PowerShell command window.
segment.target: Open the PowerShell command window.

segment.source: For info about performing Windows PowerShell commands for AppLocker, see Use the AppLocker Windows PowerShell cmdlets.
segment.target: For info about performing Windows PowerShell commands for AppLocker, see Use the AppLocker Windows PowerShell cmdlets.

segment.source: At the command prompt, type C:PSGet-AppLockerPolicy -Local | Set-AppLockerPolicy -LDAP "LDAP: //string"-Merge where string specifies the LDAP path of the unique GPO.
segment.target: At the command prompt, type C:PSGet-AppLockerPolicy -Local | Set-AppLockerPolicy -LDAP "LDAP: //string"-Merge where string specifies the LDAP path of the unique GPO.

segment.source: Example
segment.target: Example

segment.source: Gets the local AppLocker policy, and then merges the policy with the existing AppLocker policy in the GPO specified in the LDAP path.
segment.target: Gets the local AppLocker policy, and then merges the policy with the existing AppLocker policy in the GPO specified in the LDAP path.
